Title: Sr Specialist Applications Development - IT North America
Synopsis: Coordinates technical consultancy assignments which involve specialists from various disciplines.Provides deep specialist consultancy, guidance and support in…
Description:
Position Summary
IT Technology Specialist provides knowledge, consultancy and advisory within his/her area of specialism with respect to a particular (emerging) technology. IT Technology Specialist actively participates in the development and s/he promotes technology which supports the business requirements within their area of expertise. S/he may be accountable for the realization of specific deliverables in relation to IT development or s/he can lead the technical activity within their area of specialism.
A day in the life of...
Technology Expertise

Provides deep specialist consultancy, guidance and support in their specific specialism (e.g. Artificial Intelligence, Robotic Process Automation, Machine Learning, etc. based on subject expertise)
Coordinates technical consultancy assignments which involve specialists from various disciplines
Supports the technical activity (design, build, testing) in a significant or complex Innovation initiatives, accountable to the Innovation or Product Manager for the delivery and quality of technical deliverables.
What will make you successful
Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience
5+ years of hands-on experience in at least one relevant specific technology
Experience using web development tools
Proven track record of structured problem-solving experience, based on data analysis
Recognized expert in at least one relevant specific technology
Experience of successfully leading technical evaluations
Experience of resolving technical issues, including those involving 3rd parties
Certification or significant experience in other corresponding technical fields
Experience with effective communication at different levels in the organization and in English
Experience having worked in a global environment and with virtual teams
SoftSkill: Comunication skills, Continuously learn, Innovation, Organization, Problem solving

Title: Risk & Fraud Prevention Specialist
Synopsis: S/He will participate in the development and validation of data science and machine learning models and their implementation.
Description:
Who we are?

Payclip is changing the way payments work in Mexico! We are empowering people to exchange value directly from a mobile device. Clip enables anyone to accept card payments, at any time, and anywhere by turning your smartphone or tablet into a card terminal. We're a well-funded quickly growing FinTech startup. We are the leaders in our market and are accelerating to extend our lead and move into new markets.
The Role

We are looking for a Risk & Fraud Prevention Specialist to be part of this amazing and fast-growing Fintech. At Clip this candidate will be a key member of the Risk & Fraud Prevention with responsibility to deploy Risk & fraud Prevention strategies and capabilities to ensure delivery on fraud loss target while managing customer experience. S/He will participate in the development and validation of data science and machine learning models and their implementation. This person should thrive in a culture of decision based on analytics and Data Science, be able to step-back and communicate both the strategy and immediate implications on priorities. This candidate must have strong written and verbal communications skills in both English and Spanish and be willing to continue learning and loving Analytics, Machine Learning and Data Science
What will I be doing?

Develop and implement comprehensive fraud detection strategies, fraud analysis models and business rules that balance fraud loss, cost of execution, and customer experience.
Identify risk factors and trends of potentially fraudulent activity utilizing technical data analysis and statistical interpretation.
Extract and analyze data, investigate data integrity, generate metrics, and perform data and portfolio analysis.
Generate fraud metrics to show the performance of fraud systems for use in management reporting.
Analyze root cause to identify opportunities to predict, prevent and mitigate risk within processes and performance.
Partner with Data Science, Engineering, Product, Operations, and Business teams to conceive, design, and monitor fraud strategies to mitigate fraud risk in the most precise manner possible; recommend which product features to build and why.
Utilize advanced data and analytics tools to establish a metrics driven approach to optimize existing fraud strategies, in order to reduce false positive rates and increase fraud detection rates.
Identify gaps in current systems, policies and strategies and take actions to mitigate emerging fraud risks with guidance from managers.
Collaborate and partner with internal business stakeholders to promote fraud related awareness and effect change - through the coordination of fraud detection monitoring of system enhancements and trends.


Ideal Candidate

At least 2 years of fraud and risk management and prevention, experience with traditional and non-traditional payments companies.
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Mathematics, Actuary or Statistics and strong quantitative analytical experience, including background with statistical modeling & analysis.
Extensive knowledge of card-not-present (CNP) and card-present fraud schemes in Mexico and Latin America, its risk prevention methods and the detection tools for all types of environments.
Has a deep understanding of the online payments landscape across all participants – issuer, merchant, acquirer and network.
Has the ability to analyze large transactional datasets, interpret ambiguous situations, and work in a high growth and vibrant work environment.
Proficient in data analysis tools like SQL, R, phyton, looker, etc.
Experience mitigating online fraud not only related to payments, such as account takeover, phishing, online card testing, etc.
Creative problem solver and team-focused; can synthesize information and make clear, concise recommendations on a course of action, and rally teams and stakeholders alike.


Technical Knowledge

Proven knowledge on risk analytics (Credit and fraud prevention), in the financial industry (preferably in credit cards).
Strong knowledge of lending and financial products and services industry in Mexico, including key players and trends.
Excellent written and verbal communication with ability to create clear and concise summary documents of ongoing processes and provide detailed instructions to team members.
Ability to analyze complex situations and provide guidance, makes recommendations, and/or escalates arising issues timely.
Strong organization skills and ability to handle multiple projects efficiently in order to ensure projects are completed timely.
Able to interact and communicate effectively with all management levels to assess business needs in a professional manner.
SoftSkill: Analitical, Collaborate, Comunication skills, Continuously learn, Organization, Problem solving, Written and oral communication

Title: Expert Applications Development - IT North America
Synopsis: Technology expertise • Provides deep specialist guidance and support in their specific specialties (e.g. artificial intelligence, robotic process automation,…
Description:
.
Position Summary
Under the supervision and guidance of her/his primary Community of Practice Lead and Product Group Manager based in Switzerland, the Technology Expert brings deep expertise and knowledge to the product or platform team. S/He guides and promotes optimal use of technology to support the cost effective delivery of business requirements within their area of expertise. Working at the leading edge of IT for the product or platform, the Technology Expert performs preliminary studies, helping to set the technological direction with the product or platform manager. S/He supports delivery and sustain of the most complex applications and business capabilities, and may be accountable for specific deliverables in relation to development or support or may lead the technical activity within their area of specialty.
A day in the life of...
Technology expertise • Provides deep specialist guidance and support in their specific specialties (e.g. artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, machine learning, etc., based on subject expertise) • Supports the integration of solutions with various technologies • Supports and influences the technical activity (design, build, testing) in significant or complex innovation initiatives, accountable to the Innovation or Product Manager for the delivery and quality of technical deliverables.
Operational effectiveness and efficiency • Makes recommendations on how to improve the effectiveness, efficiency and delivery of services through the use of (emerging) technology and technical methods and methodologies • Provides the product team with technical expertise, advising on best technology solutions, translating the business vision into technical vision • Participates in the development of and/or review of standards, documentation and methods of working in the relevant area of expertise • Performs preliminary studies, general systems specifications and detailed systems specifications • Considers a broad range of options and applies sound judgment to develop solutions within their specific specialism • Ensures solution operational readiness: defines global procedures and processes for operations in the area of expertise • Ensures IT Customer and Consumer requirements are met and service quality maintained when introducing new products. Considers the cost effectiveness of proposed solutions.
Security, compliance & risk management • Responsible for ensuring that all solutions within their technology area are delivered and maintained secure and compliant with internal standards and external regulations, including privacy requirements • Understands the business risk appetite and delivers applications within that acceptable risk level.
Stakeholder engagement • Works with IT Innovation managers, Product managers, Tech Leads, Solution Architects and Business Analysts as required to ensure any solution within their specific specialism fits with strategic and technical direction • Assists others in resolving complex technical problems and investigating the root cause of problems and recommends smart (specific, measurable, achievable, realistic, timely) solutions • Participates in peer reviews of deliverables and carries out formal and informal reviews of technical designs, standards, documentation and/or implementations • Provides guidance, directions and also, if needed, technical support to product teams, mentoring and sharing technology knowledge with the teams.
Supplier and strategic partners management • Liaises closely with suppliers and vendors, for example where third party work or packages involve significant functional, technical, process, data or integration decisions.
What will make you successful
4 years of experience.
Strong tech and business process knowledge on SAP – FI / CO experience.
Business integrations.
Understanding of the business process.
Knowledge of Service Now.
Tech support: Focused mostly on 1L (non-limiting).
Nice to have: Experience on central finance, CPG / Manufacturing industry.
Soft Skills:
Proactive.
Problem solving.
Consultive.
.
SoftSkill: Continuously learn, Efficiency, Innovation, Problem solving, strategic

Title: Specialist, Material Costing and Awards
Synopsis: Maintains global and/or regional responsibility for a complex commodity or group of commodities for price/value determination, product and/or service…
Description:
Req ID: 93077
Region: Americas
Country: Mexico
State/Province: Nuevo Leon
City: Monterrey

Our Global Supply Chain operates as a unified virtual system with our customers and suppliers by acting as seamless extensions of their operations. We offer customized, flexible and integrated supply chain solutions, supported by a global technology platform and a dedicated, market-focused team.

We are currently seeking a Specialist, Material Costing and Awards based out of Monterrey, MX.

Responsibilities:
Maintains global and/or regional responsibility for a complex commodity or group of commodities for price/value determination, product and/or service negotiations, terms and conditions, supplier relationship development and performance.
Develops and executes a procurement strategy for commodity or services including competitive benchmarking, technology direction, supplier analysis, development, selection and pricing strategy.
Responsible for all product or service sourcing.
Participates in the Customer Materials Commitment process through collection of materials pricing and Customer BOM analysis.
Conducts customer bids within the response time objectives.
Responsible for supplier performance reviews including performance reviews, business development and supplier awards programs.
Has frequent interaction and negotiation with senior executives of industry-leading multi-national companies.
Provides support to their internal customers.
Provides product cost support for products in assigned geographies.
Prepares bids including generation of BOM, cost analysis, negotiate with suppliers, and present bids to management.
Data Pipeline: Gather required data, organize and manage the data, clean and prepare for modelling.
Data Analysis: Design, develop and deploy Machine Learning Models for consumption by Business users.
Story Telling: Develop dashboards and recurring reports to translate data & information into insight.
Updates material prices database, analyze bill of materials for competitiveness and customer compliance, review with management.
Provides guidance to less experienced Commodity Management staff.
Provides guidance to counterparts at the sites to ensure process compliance.
Requirements:
Broad knowledge of the marketplace conditions for the area of specialization including industry pricing, technology and supply/demand trends.
Working knowledge of Celestica’s global supply chain including strategic policies and objectives.
Strong knowledge of basic computer applications and the ability to learn and use multiple applications specific to this department including ERP and office systems.
Advanced Excel skills.
Strong knowledge of purchasing principles and procedures.
Understanding of specific customer needs.
Strong communication, negotiation and presentation skills.
Ability to consolidate, manipulate and analyze large quantities of data.
Ability to handle multiple tasks while maintaining attention to detail and accuracy and working under tight time deadlines.
Ability to evaluate, prioritize and problem solve a variety of tasks to ensure their timely and accurate completion.
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with a wide variety of internal and external customers.
Working knowledge of Power BI is an asset
Develop and manage Business Intelligence data, and strategies
Familiarity with visualization products such as PowerBI or Tableau.
The ability to quickly familiarize yourself with new languages, tools, frameworks, and to stay informed on developments in ML techniques and technologies

Experience:

Five to Seven years of relevant experience.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in related field (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Commerce), or consideration of an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Supply Chain Management designation an asset.

Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law).

At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Special arrangements can be made for candidates who need it throughout the hiring process. Please indicate your needs and we will work with you to meet them.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) enables the world’s best brands. Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development – from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud.

Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.

Celestica would like to thank all applicants, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.

Celestica does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services.
SoftSkill: Attention to details, Comunication skills, Continuously learn, strategic

Title: Project Manager Mexico
Synopsis: Por lo anterior, en SimpliRoute apostamos fuertemente en las nuevas tecnologías, siempre con un mindset agile, pero por sobre todo a las personas.
Description:
SimpliRoute está cambiando el mundo de la logística en Latinoamérica: Nuestra plataforma permite a cualquier empresa llevar su logística al siguiente nivel al poder conectar a sus clientes, sus repartidores y administradores en una plataforma de inteligencia que permite reducir sus costos logísticos en hasta un 30% al utilizar algoritmos de optimización avanzados y machine learning. Por lo anterior, en SimpliRoute apostamos fuertemente en las nuevas tecnologías, siempre con un mindset agile, pero por sobre todo a las personas. Creemos que el éxito de nuestra empresa está dado en el foco en las personas y colaboraciones que la componen. Si quieres saber más de nosotros, revisa acá un artículo que habla más en detalle de nuestra visión y de cómo estamos escalando a toda Latinoamérica.

¿Cuáles serán tus responsabilidades?

El/La Implementation Specialist (Project Manager) formará parte del equipo de operaciones de SimpliRoute.

Operaciones se ocupa del Onboarding del cliente en nuestra plataforma y de que el cliente tenga la mejor experiencia de uso posible.
Lo que necesitamos de ti es:
Asegurarte que nuestros clientes saquen el máximo provecho de SimpliRoute desde el momento en que deciden trabajar con nosotros: Es clave que sepas como funciona nuestra plataforma pero también entiendas como nuestros clientes quieren usarla. Entender sus expectativas y saber canalizar su feedback es clave. Debes relacionarte muy bien con nuestra área comercial para anticipar las necesidades de cada implementación!
Velar por los intereses de nuestros clientes. Debes ser capaz de transmitir los requerimientos operacionales y armar cada caso de uso. Debes ser capaz de identificar los puntos críticos de cada caso de uso para transmitir a área de producto las funcionalidades que cada caso necesita.
Administrar la relación comercial con los clientes: tú representas a los clientes dentro de SimpliRoute pero también debes también representar nuestros intereses frente a los clientes y mantener todo en equilibrio!
¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos una persona que pueda administrar la relación con los clientes desde el inicio de ésta (lo que implica en algunos casos apoyar la venta de un proyecto), liderar el proceso de implementación de nuestra plataforma y luego hacer seguimiento constante a las cuentas asignadas, siendo capaz de administrar las expectativas, solicitudes y problemas que nuestros clientes puedan tener. Eres la voz de nuestros clientes dentro de nuestra organización, y para nosotros lo más importante es que nuestros clientes estén contentos con nosotros!
¿Qué necesitas saber?

Manejo de proyectos: Diseño, seguimiento e implementación de proyectos utilizando metodologías que permitan el trabajo eficiente e iterativo.
Experiencia y habilidad en la identificación, diseño y mejora de procesos del rubro logístico
Empatizar con tus contrapartes: Es clave poder entender lo que nuestros clientes quieren para así ayudarlos a conseguirlo con nuestra herramienta.
Excel avanzado
Conocimientos de herramientas de Business Intelligence (BI)

Requisitos no excluyentes:
Ingeniería Civil Industrial, Ingeniería Comercial, Administración de empresas o experiencia laboral en el área es relevante.
Deseables
Manejo de Ingles Intermedio
Beneficios
Ambiente de trabajo relajado y desafiante: Somos un equipo joven con experiencia en el desarrollo de grandes soluciones que entreguen gran valor a nuestros clientes. Creemos en nuestro equipo y en sus capacidades por lo que el ambiente es relajado pero altamente desafiante.
Un bono anual de desempeño, el cual podrás alcanzar según tú resultados y participación con el equipo.
Pertenecer a equipos de personas que constantemente se centran en el crecimiento profesional junto a planes de capacitación donde tu puedes elegir dónde formarse.‍‍
Convenio con Poliglota para reforzar, mejorar y/o aprender inglés.
Día Libre de Cumpleaños para que puedas descansar y celebrar en Familia
Prestaciones superiores a la de ley:
Bono para implementación teletrabajo
Seguro de Vida y seguro de Gastos Médicos Mayores
Seguro de Gastos Médicos Menores
Computer provided SimpliRoute provides a computer for your work.
Informal dress code No dress code is enforced.
Vacation over legal SimpliRoute gives you paid vacations over the legal minimum.
Vacation on birthday Your birthday counts as an extra day of vacation.
Remote work policy

Temporarily remote during COVID-19

Position is remote only during COVID-19-related restrictions.
SoftSkill: Continuously learn
Full Description:
Por lo anterior, en SimpliRoute apostamos fuertemente en las nuevas tecnologías, siempre con un mindset agile, pero por sobre todo a las personas. SimpliRoute está cambiando el mundo de la logística en Latinoamérica: Nuestra plataforma permite a cualquier empresa llevar su logística al siguiente nivel al poder conectar a sus clientes, sus repartidores y administradores en una plataforma de inteligencia que permite reducir sus costos logísticos en hasta un 30% al utilizar algoritmos de optimización avanzados y machine learning. Por lo anterior, en SimpliRoute apostamos fuertemente en las nuevas tecnologías, siempre con un mindset agile, pero por sobre todo a las personas. Creemos que el éxito de nuestra empresa está dado en el foco en las personas y colaboraciones que la componen. Si quieres saber más de nosotros, revisa acá un artículo que habla más en detalle de nuestra visión y de cómo estamos escalando a toda Latinoamérica.

¿Cuáles serán tus responsabilidades?

El/La Implementation Specialist (Project Manager) formará parte del equipo de operaciones de SimpliRoute.

Operaciones se ocupa del Onboarding del cliente en nuestra plataforma y de que el cliente tenga la mejor experiencia de uso posible.
Lo que necesitamos de ti es:
Asegurarte que nuestros clientes saquen el máximo provecho de SimpliRoute desde el momento en que deciden trabajar con nosotros: Es clave que sepas como funciona nuestra plataforma pero también entiendas como nuestros clientes quieren usarla. Entender sus expectativas y saber canalizar su feedback es clave. Debes relacionarte muy bien con nuestra área comercial para anticipar las necesidades de cada implementación!
Velar por los intereses de nuestros clientes. Debes ser capaz de transmitir los requerimientos operacionales y armar cada caso de uso. Debes ser capaz de identificar los puntos críticos de cada caso de uso para transmitir a área de producto las funcionalidades que cada caso necesita.
Administrar la relación comercial con los clientes: tú representas a los clientes dentro de SimpliRoute pero también debes también representar nuestros intereses frente a los clientes y mantener todo en equilibrio!
¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos una persona que pueda administrar la relación con los clientes desde el inicio de ésta (lo que implica en algunos casos apoyar la venta de un proyecto), liderar el proceso de implementación de nuestra plataforma y luego hacer seguimiento constante a las cuentas asignadas, siendo capaz de administrar las expectativas, solicitudes y problemas que nuestros clientes puedan tener. Eres la voz de nuestros clientes dentro de nuestra organización, y para nosotros lo más importante es que nuestros clientes estén contentos con nosotros!
¿Qué necesitas saber?

Manejo de proyectos: Diseño, seguimiento e implementación de proyectos utilizando metodologías que permitan el trabajo eficiente e iterativo.
Experiencia y habilidad en la identificación, diseño y mejora de procesos del rubro logístico
Empatizar con tus contrapartes: Es clave poder entender lo que nuestros clientes quieren para así ayudarlos a conseguirlo con nuestra herramienta.
Excel avanzado
Conocimientos de herramientas de Business Intelligence (BI)

Requisitos no excluyentes:
Ingeniería Civil Industrial, Ingeniería Comercial, Administración de empresas o experiencia laboral en el área es relevante.
Deseables
Manejo de Ingles Intermedio
Beneficios
Ambiente de trabajo relajado y desafiante: Somos un equipo joven con experiencia en el desarrollo de grandes soluciones que entreguen gran valor a nuestros clientes. Creemos en nuestro equipo y en sus capacidades por lo que el ambiente es relajado pero altamente desafiante.
Un bono anual de desempeño, el cual podrás alcanzar según tú resultados y participación con el equipo.
Pertenecer a equipos de personas que constantemente se centran en el crecimiento profesional junto a planes de capacitación donde tu puedes elegir dónde formarse.‍‍
Convenio con Poliglota para reforzar, mejorar y/o aprender inglés.
Día Libre de Cumpleaños para que puedas descansar y celebrar en Familia
Prestaciones superiores a la de ley:
Bono para implementación teletrabajo
Seguro de Vida y seguro de Gastos Médicos Mayores
Seguro de Gastos Médicos Menores
Computer provided SimpliRoute provides a computer for your work.
Informal dress code No dress code is enforced.
Vacation over legal SimpliRoute gives you paid vacations over the legal minimum.
Vacation on birthday Your birthday counts as an extra day of vacation.
Remote work policy

Temporarily remote during COVID-19

Position is remote only during COVID-19-related restrictions.

Title: Data Scientist
Synopsis: Leverage methods from diverse disciplines like machine learning, statistical modelling, information theory, information retrieval and other areas to gain…
Description:
Services
Your Role & Responsibilities:
Carry out data processing and analysis including statistical analysis, variable selection, dimensionality reduction, custom attribute engineering, etc.
Help with the design, development, evaluation and monitoring of predictive models and advanced algorithms that help business to drive decisions throughout the customer lifecycle
Leverage methods from diverse disciplines like machine learning, statistical modelling, information theory, information retrieval and other areas to gain customer insights, draw conclusions and work with business partners to put those insights into action
Work closely with Digital Automation Specialist, Green Belts, business partners, technology and customer analytics teams to evaluate new and alternate data sources as well as computing paradigms and analytical tools
Participate in data architecture decisions and partner with technology teams to implement models/algorithms in production systems
Develop technical, functional & operational skills related to Process Mining
Develop metrics providing detailed insight into daily status of operations
Develop best practice big data and process mining solutions;
Support the business analyzing their processes to create a solution design for the technical implementation;
Responsible for the quality assured delivery of data science solutions to the business;

Your Skills & Strenghts:
College / university or comparable educational institution. Quantitative discipline such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, economics, quantitative psychology, or operations research.
Strong expertise in multivariate analysis, time series analysis, information theory, machine learning, statistical modeling techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, survival analysis, tree models, cluster analysis, principal components, feature creation, and validation.
Strong expertise in regularization techniques, varable selection techniques, feature creation and/or dimensionality reduction techniques in financial services, customer analytics, digital marketing, or similar domains.
Experience working with large data sets and Big Data tools/stacks and with one or more modeling tools (R, Matlab, Octave) and one or more mainstream programming language (Python, Java, C, Scala, C++).
Ability to explain complex statistical models and analysis to drive business ideas
Project Management experience
Good communication and organizational skills
Self-motivated, customer-oriented and detail-oriented
Knowledge of ERP systems (SAP) is a major plus
Process modelling skills are a plus
Green Belt certification is a plus

 Do you have any questions?

Are you interested in working with us and developing efficient and environmentally-friendly solutions, optimising existing products, and turning innovative ideas into reality? Title: Lead Generation Specialist- Remote MX
Synopsis: We are creating the future of retail - investing in machine learning, computer vision, automation, and robotics.Plan, develop and implement our SEO strategy.
Description:
About Swyft


Swyft is a leading automated retail technology company for great brands and retailers. We partner, develop, and operate thousands of retail points for the world’s top brands such as iStore, Benefit Cosmetics, CVS, Pokemon, and many others. We are creating the future of retail - investing in machine learning, computer vision, automation, and robotics.

Lead Generation Specialist is responsible for marketing outreach via email campaigns, SEO, online advertising to generate qualified leads for Swyft’s Location sales and Technology sales teams.

 The Lead Generation Specialist is a marketing professional who is specialized in lead generating with the goal of converting sales leads into customers. Lead Generation Specialist is responsible for handling all inbound traffic, converting that traffic into new leads, and providing regular reporting activities to CMO.

Are you a talented marketing mind especially passionate about inbound marketing tactics?

Then you might be the perfect candidate we are looking for! We are seeking to hire an experienced Lead Generation Specialist whose main responsibility will be to turn interested, qualified leads into successful customers.

If you are a revenue marketer with a growth-hacking mind able to thrive in a fast-paced environment, we would like to hear from you!


Duties and responsibilities

Analyze and interpret what behaviors and patterns make customers successful and more likely to be retained by the company
Establish closed-loop analytics to understand the metrics at which our inbound marketing activity turns into customers, and continually refine our process to convert customers
Create the strategy for nurturing our leads through a mix of helpful content and other calls-to-action
Optimize marketing automation and lead nurturing processes through email, content, landing pages, and social media channels
Monitor industry trends, competitive intelligence, and market conditions
Keeping abreast of new trends and applying best practices in inbound marketing
Plan, develop and implement our SEO strategy
Work towards organic search optimization and ROI maximization
Regularly perform thorough keywords research
Identify key SEO KPIs
Monitor redirects, click rate, bounce rate, and other KPIs
Prepare and present reports regularly
Identify our buyer persona to better target identified audiences
Identify problems and deficiencies and implement solutions in a timely manner
Suggest improvements for process and productivity optimization
Collaborate effectively with stakeholders across teams


Requirements and qualifications

Previous experience working as a Lead Generation for 5 years
MA in Marketing or similar relevant field
Excellent communicator and creative thinker
Data-driven problem solver
3+ years of experience with planning and implementing a successful SEO strategy
Proven success in SEO
3+ years of experience in web analytics, marketing, and business development
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Ability to analyze data and provide evidence-based recommendations
Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company’s success
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
Team player, Good time-management skills, and great interpersonal and communication skills

What’s in it for you

Competitive salary
All employees participate in the equity options plan
Excellent benefits package for MX employees
Yearly well-being fund; includes home office equipment
Flexible paid vacation program
Flexible scheduling/hours
Flexible remote work options
Paid sick and parental leave in accordance with Mexican Labor Law


Compensation: Salary: Depending upon experience. Benefits available, Full time, Fully remote work

We hope you’re excited about the role! Even if you don’t feel like you meet every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in Swyft’s mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways - not just candidates who check all the boxes.

Know more about us: https://swyftstore.com/

What we do? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g-pTPAbDLRM

Our Products

We nurture a sense of community by investing in one another's unique backgrounds and experiences to drive business success and positively influence our services and products.


We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or expression (including against any individual that is transitioning, has transitioned, or is perceived to be transitioning), marital status or civil partnership/union status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, childbirth, genetic information, military, and veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law.

Title: General IT Applications Development-P40 - IT North America
Synopsis: Provides deep specialist guidance and support in their specific specialties (e.g. artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, machine learning, etc.,…
Description:
Position Summary

The Technology Expert brings deep expertise and knowledge to the product or platform team. S/He guides and promotes optimal use of technology to support the cost effective delivery of business requirements within their area of expertise. Working at the leading edge of IT for the product or platform, the Technology Expert performs preliminary studies, helping to set the technological direction with the product or platform manager. S/He supports delivery and sustain of the most complex applications and business capabilities, and may be accountable for specific deliverables in relation to development or support or may lead the technical activity within their area of specialty.

A day in the life of...
Technology expertise
Provides deep specialist guidance and support in their specific specialties (e.g. artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, machine learning, etc., based on subject expertise)
Supports the integration of solutions with various technologies
Supports and influences the technical activity (design, build, testing) in significant or complex innovation initiatives, accountable to the Innovation or Product Manager for the delivery and quality of technical deliverables
Management of SAP platform to support all the financial analysis.
What will make you successful
 5 + years of experience
Profitability Analysis- SAP CO PA
Focus on the financial part
Management of SAP platform to support all the financial analysis.
No need to develop, just create projects and manage them.
Curious & Innovative
Courageous
Collaborative
Can Do & Results Driven
Inclusive

 Project Management
Knowledge of more SAP Modules.

Title: Risk Analytics Specialist
Synopsis: S/He will participate in the development and validation of data science and machine learning models and their implementation.
Description:
Who we are?

Payclip is changing the way payments work in Mexico! We are empowering people to exchange value directly from a mobile device. Clip enables anyone to accept card payments, at any time, and anywhere by turning your smartphone or tablet into a card terminal. We're a well-funded quickly growing FinTech startup. We are the leaders in our market and are accelerating to extend our lead and move into new markets.
The Role

We are looking for a Risk Analytics Specialist to be part of this amazing and fast-growing Fintech. At Clip this candidate will be a key member of the Risk & Fraud Prevention with responsibility to deploy Risk & fraud Prevention strategies and capabilities to ensure delivery on fraud loss target while managing customer experience. S/He will participate in the development and validation of data science and machine learning models and their implementation. This person should thrive in a culture of decision based on analytics and Data Science, be able to step-back and communicate both the strategy and immediate implications on priorities. This candidate must have strong written and verbal communications skills in both English and Spanish and be willing to continue learning and loving Analytics.
What will I be doing?

Develop and implement comprehensive risk & fraud detection strategies, risk analysis models and business rules that balance fraud loss, cost of execution, and customer experience.
Identify risk factors and trends of potentially fraudulent activity utilizing technical data analysis and statistical interpretation.
Extract and analyze data, investigate data integrity, generate metrics, and perform data and portfolio analysis.
Generate risk & fraud metrics to show the performance of fraud systems for use in management reporting.
Analyze root cause to identify opportunities to predict, prevent and mitigate risk within processes and performance.
Partner with Data Science, Engineering, Product, Operations, and Business teams to conceive, design, and monitor fraud strategies to mitigate fraud risk in the most precise manner possible; recommend which product features to build and why.
Utilize advanced data and analytics tools to establish a metrics driven approach to optimize existing fraud strategies, in order to reduce false positive rates and increase fraud detection rates.
Identify gaps in current systems, policies and strategies and take actions to mitigate emerging fraud risks with guidance from managers.
Collaborate and partner with internal business stakeholders to promote fraud related awareness and effect change - through the coordination of fraud detection monitoring of system enhancements and trends.

Ideal Candidate

Proven knowledge on risk analytics (Credit and fraud prevention), in the financial industry (preferably in credit cards).
Strong knowledge of lending and financial products and services industry in Mexico, including key players and trends.
Excellent written and verbal communication with ability to create clear and concise summary documents of ongoing processes and provide detailed instructions to team members.
Ability to analyze complex situations and provide guidance, makes recommendations, and/or escalates arising issues timely.
Strong organization skills and ability to handle multiple projects efficiently in order to ensure projects are completed timely.
Able to interact and communicate effectively with all management levels to assess business needs in a professional manner.
Extensive knowledge of card-not-present (CNP) and card-present fraud schemes in Mexico and Latin America, its risk prevention methods and the detection tools for all types of environments.
Has a deep understanding of the online payments landscape across all participants – issuer, merchant, acquirer and network.
Has the ability to analyze large transactional datasets, interpret ambiguous situations, and work in a high growth and vibrant work environment.
Proficient in data analysis tools like SQL, R, phyton, looker, etc.
Experience mitigating online fraud not only related to payments, such as account takeover, phishing, online card testing, etc.
Creative problem solver and team-focused; can synthesize information and make clear, concise recommendations on a course of action, and rally teams and stakeholders alike.
SoftSkill: Analitical, Collaborate, Comunication skills, Continuously learn, Organization, Problem solving, Written and oral communication

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Synopsis: Selecting features, building, and optimizing classifiers / regressors, etc. using machine learning & deep learning techniques.
Description:
Why join frog?

Joining frog means you'll be joining the "pond," a global network of studios, each with a thriving in-person and vibrant virtual culture. As a leading global creative consultancy that is part of Capgemini Invent, frog challenges the status quo to craft and build transformative human experiences that win hearts and move markets. Partnering with passionate leaders and visionary entrepreneurs, we apply creativity, strategy, design and data to re-invent businesses, drive growth and orchestrate customer-centric transformation. Together we strive to shape a regenerative future that is both sustainable and inclusive for businesses, people and planet. Our culture is open, flexible, inclusive and engaging. Working at frog means being empowered to Make Your Mark on every project, in your studio, your community—and the world at large.

 The Position:
The Senior Data Scientist is a multi-disciplinary specialist, working in a collaborative environment with global teams to drive client engagements. The Senior Data Scientist will work across a broad range of industries to design and build scalable Data Analytics solutions, solve business problems and create value by leveraging client data.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate across multiple teams to provide data-driven recommendations and solutions to clients
Work with team to quickly understand client needs, develop solutions, and collaboratively present findings to client executives
Use industry expertise and data science experience to uncover new opportunities with clients' data
Analyze and model both structured and unstructured data
Perform EDA and feature engineering to both inform the development of statistical models and generate improve model performance and flexibility
Selecting features, building, and optimizing classifiers / regressors, etc. using machine learning & deep learning techniques.
Design and build scalable machine learning models to meet the needs of given client engagement
Assist in growing data science practice by meeting business goals through client prospecting, responding to proposals, identifying and closing opportunities within identified client accounts
Work with client's engineering teams to deploy the developed solutions

Qualifications

10+ years professional work experience as a data scientist or on advanced analytics/statistics projects
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or other related field
Excellent team-oriented and interpersonal skills, with a strong interest for consulting
Experience in Python/R is required. Knowledge of both languages is preferred.
Experience in working with any of the following databases – SQL server, Oracle, Teradata

Must have skills
Outstanding communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate findings and present solutions to business partners
Experience in Statistical modeling techniques and applied statistics
Experience with building and deploying predictive and prescriptive analytics models
Excellent understanding and hand-on experience of machine learning techniques and algorithms for supervised and unsupervised learning (e.g. k-NN, Regression, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Tree, Random Forests, k-means, PCA etc.).
Familiarity with Cloud-based environments such as AWS (S3/EC2), Azure, Google Cloud
Experience with data science toolkits such as NumPy, Pandas, StatModel, Scikit learn, SciPy, NLTK, Spacy, Gensim, OpenCV etc.

Optional requirements

Experience in NLP, computer vision, sentiment analysis, topic modeling
Good understanding of Deep-learning models for text & image analytics (such as ANNs, CNNs, LSTM, Transfer Learning, Encoder and decoder, etc).
Experience in working with advanced machine learning libraries - Pytorch, TensorFlow, Keras and a good understanding of modelling platforms (Azure AutoML, SageMaker, DataBricks, DataRobot and H2O.ai)
Comprehensive knowledge of AWS architecture, tools, principles and integration methods
Knowledge and experience with designing high volume data pipelines for data lakes and data warehouses
Experienced in defining data models
Knowledge/ experience to execute large dataset on Hadoop, Pyspark, etc
Some exposure to analytics/ML/AI/AIOps in support of data scientists would be a plus
Experience as a Data Engineer on an AIOPs project would be a plus
Experience in designing and deploying dashboards for business users
Knowledge and experience in using BI tools like PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

frog is a global business with teams working across the world. To help us process your application, please ensure that your application documents (CV, cover letter, portfolio, etc.) are all in English.

Title: Specialist Applications Development - IT North America
Synopsis: Provides deep specialist guidance and support in their specific specialties (e.g. artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, machine learning, etc.,…
Description:
Position Summary

IT Technology Specialist provides knowledge, consultancy and advisory within his/her area of specialism with respect to a particular (emerging) technology. IT Technology Specialist actively participates in the development and s/he promotes technology which supports the business requirements within their area of expertise. S/he may be accountable for the realization of specific deliverables in relation to IT development or s/he can lead the technical activity within their area of specialism.

A day in the life of...
Provides deep specialist guidance and support in their specific specialties (e.g. artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, machine learning, etc., based on subject expertise)Supports the integration of solutions with various technologies.Supports and influences the technical activity (design, build, testing) in significant or complex innovation initiatives, accountable to the Innovation or Product Manager for the delivery and quality of technical deliverables.
Makes recommendations on how to improve the effectiveness, efficiency and delivery of services through the use of (emerging) technology and technical methods and methodologies.
Provides the product team with technical expertise, advising on best technology solutions, translating the business vision into technical vision.Participates in the development of and/or review of standards, documentation and methods of working in the relevant area of expertise.
Performs preliminary studies, general systems specifications and detailed systems specifications.
Considers a broad range of options and applies sound judgment to develop solutions within their specific specialismEnsures solution operational readiness: defines global procedures and processes for operations in the area of expertise
Ensures IT Customer and Consumer requirements are met and service quality maintained when introducing new products. Considers the cost effectiveness of proposed solutions


What will make you successful
Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience5+ years of hands-on experience in SAP COProven track record of structured problem-solving experience, based on data analysisRecognized expert in at least one relevant specific technologyExperience of successfully leading technical evaluationsExperience of resolving technical issues, including those involving 3rd partiesCertification or significant experience in other corresponding technical fieldsExperience with effective communication at different levels in the organization and in EnglishExperience having worked in a global environment and with virtual teams
SoftSkill: Comunication skills, Continuously learn, Efficiency, Innovation, Organization, Problem solving

Title: Installation Specialist - Bilingual English/Spanish
Synopsis: Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of…
Description:
Who we are:
Geotab ® is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified “Great Place to Work™.” We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.
Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotab’s open platform and Geotab Marketplace ®, offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.
Our team is growing and we’re looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what it’s like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram, Twitter or Facebook.
Who you are:
We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking an Installation Specialist who will interact with and grow our Authorized Installer program as well as visit our customers to train and validate quality installations as well as work with internal teams to solve complex issues. If you love technology, are passionate about working with complex projects, and are keen to join an industry leader — we would love to hear from you!
What you'll do:
As the Installation Specialist you will be a crucial resource to the Operations, Sales Engineering and Field Service team. Our hardware is being installed more than 2.1 million vehicles in 84 countries across the globe. Your job is to develop and expand an install network that can accommodate an ever growing customer base with top notch onsite installers and retail locations. You will need to work closely with the Field Services team to understand project requirements, Geotab’s Sales and Reseller teams, as well as other internal stakeholders. To be successful in this role, you will have strong communication and critical thinking skills to bridge the gap between technical prowess and business value. The Installation Specialist will also need to be technically adept at installing all available products and be able to deliver hands on technical training at a customer or installer location.


How you'll make an impact:
Work with customers, sales professionals and installers to ensure installation requirements are understood, priced correctly, delivered on time and in accordance to company standards.
The GO Device is a GPS Telematics device installed in Fleet vehicles, understand device installations
Inspect Installations by our certified installers for quality assurance
Oversee Pilot projects and large deployments.
Coordinate installation of pilot projects involving complex solution implementation and new product introduction. Ensure company deliverables meet customer requirements.
Work with Product and Engineering teams on issue investigations and new solution development.
Work with Sales and Solution Engineers on RFP responses and pricing for installation services.
Support Field Service Coordinators in the award of projects to third party installers, set timeline expectations and ensure they are met.
Support in the development of installation guides and instructions that communicate company standards and ensure the updated information is communicated to the installers.
Source and qualify new installers, provide installer training for new products and services, resolve installer issues and concerns.
Participate in installer performance evaluation and audits. Ensure company installation quality standards are communicated and adhered to in the field.
Author installations audit reports and email to Field Service Vendor Manager at every opportunity.
Ensure the installation guides, instructions and other important information are communicated to the installers.
Work with installers to ensure they understand and use the Field Services department price list for installation services.
When required, perform installations in the field as a part of an installation project or installation training.
Fulfill installation paperwork requirements: perform photo sets, send out feedback surveys, support Field Services invoicing processes, and update the ticketing system.
Continually seek and suggest methods to improve systems and processes within the organization, especially as related to installations and onsite services.
Maintain the installer network database by keeping the database current.
Prepare periodic Field Service status reports.
What you'll bring to this role:
Post-Secondary Diploma/Degree or equivalent experience required.
Diploma/Degree specialization in electrical electronics, industrial management or a related field highly valued.
English and Spanish required
Installation and Automotive experience is necessary.
3-5 years of experience working as installation field service specialist in AVL industry, or equivalent.
Solid knowledge of electronic components and automotive industry.
Understanding of vehicle equipment maintenance.
Experience managing 3rd party contractor relationships.
Outstanding customer service skills.
Ability to solve problems under time pressure with frequent interruptions, and work effectively in a variety of roles with both technical and non-technical personnel.
Ability to learn and absorb new procedural information, and disseminate it to end-users.
Ability to quickly develop rapport with customers and partners.
Experience working within a technical or engineering organization/knowledge of the high-technology industry is an asset.
High accuracy and meticulous attention to detail.
Highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong interpersonal relationship building skills.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to problem-solve to well-judged decisions.
A strong team-player with the ability to engage with all levels of the organization.
Technical competence using software programs, including, but not limited to, Google Suite for business (Sheets, Docs, Slides).
Ability to travel up to 30% of the time
Passport required/Ability to travel internationally.
Must be flexible with work schedule to accommodate different time zones.
Availability to work different shifts, including weekends.
This position is remote, therefore the physical location can be anywhere.
Entrepreneurial mindset and comfortable in a flat organization.
If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed above, we still encourage you to apply.
How we work:
At Geotab, we understand that the world is always changing and that we need to change with it. Geotab has adopted a hybrid model for working, including a flexible work from home program, with the opportunity to work in our safe, clean offices. When working from home, you are required to have a reliable internet connection with at least 50mb DL/10mb UL. Virtual work is supported with cloud-based applications, collaboration tools and asynchronous working. The health and safety of employees are a top priority. We encourage work-life balance and keep the Geotab culture going strong with online social events, chat rooms and gatherings. Join us and help reshape the future of technology!
We believe that ensuring diversity is fundamental to our future growth and progress and is an integral part of our business. We believe that success happens where new ideas can flourish – in an environment that is rich in diversity and a place where people from various backgrounds can work together. Geotab encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to accommodating people with disabilities during the recruitment and assessment processes and when people are hired. We will ensure the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities are taken into account as part of performance management, career development, training and redeployment processes. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information about our diversity and inclusion as well as accommodation policies and practices, please contact us at careers@geotab.com. Click here to learn more about what happens with your personal data.
SoftSkill: Analitical, Attention to details, Collaborate, Comunication skills, Continuously learn, Critical Thinking, Interpersonal, Organization, Written and oral communication

Title: Analytics & Optimization Specialist (CRO)
Synopsis: The Analytics & Optimization Manager will play a key role in maintaining a portfolio of Analytics & Optimization clients’ projects, either directly, or through…
Description:
The Analytics & Optimization Manager will play a key role in maintaining a portfolio of Analytics & Optimization clients’ projects, either directly, or through advising others.You will be responsible for leading the client data measurement, optimization and personalization strategy as well as the day to day management of assigned client accounts and planned campaigns, focusing on successful measurement insights discovery, measurement tracking implementation and optimisation of their marketing channels, journeys and web properties.
Responsibilities

Be a passionate subject matter expert on digital marketing, digital measurement, web analysis (inc. web analytics, app tracking, audience strategy, incremental revenue), Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO), Personalization and Usability and possess a strong understanding of the media ecosystem, particularly GMP and mainstream optimization and personalization platforms
Drive performance of analytics and optimization capabilities to impact overall business results
Provide support and mentorship for other members of the team, ensuring they are progressively able to take on more complex tasks and upskill others
Find opportunities for the business to cross-sell other services, including data analysis, attribution, ad-tech, CRM integration, marketing automation, UX, Visual Design, Development, QA, etc
Work closely with the Development, QA, UX, Design, Content and Project Management teams to strategize, ideate, define and run the planned projects and campaigns and to communicate strategy, progress and results

Requirements: What you’ll need

Demonstrable experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager, both web and apps, is required
Demonstrable experience with Google Optimize and/or other mainstream web & app Optimization and Personalization platforms (eg. Adobe Target, Evergage, Dynamic Yield, Monetate, Leanplum, Tune, Optimizely, Qubit, etc.)
Must have a fluent understanding of Google Marketing Platform, the key benefits and how to leverage the Google stack to the greatest advantage of clients
Hands-on experience working with analytics and experience optimization solutions, ranging from auditing, campaign ideation, definition, setup, launch and reporting, measurement implementations, data analysis & insights, in-housing.
Strong experience in unearthing insights and forming optimization recommendations using heat-mapping
Ability to clearly communicate processes, strategies and general requirements to internal stakeholders
Able to manage projects and delegate seamlessly across multiple teams and regions, to ensure that all deliverables are as per Jellyfish standards and deadlines are met
Able to stay positive under pressure, teamwork with a diverse set of stakeholders and live Jellyfish’s values: be positive, be the solution, be passionate, be accountable, be you

Advantageous: 

Proficiency with Python/R or other scripting languages is highly desirable
Experience with Google Cloud Platform and BigQuery, ability to query large databases and write SQL queries
Experience with (and positive results from) running campaigns on other web and app experience optimization / personalization platforms besides Google Optimize 360 would be highly desirable
Knowledge and experience with recent Google technologies and tools such as Google Analytics for Firebase, App+Web properties and Google Ads Data Hub is a very big plus
Knowledge and experience with Machine Learning principles and Marketing theory is a big plus
Knowledge and experience with advanced segmentation analysis, session playback, lo-fi wireframing, treejacking, designing polls and surveys will be a big plus
Nice to have experience with the following: Adobe Marketing Cloud, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Segment, Tableau and Looker

Job Type: Full-time
SoftSkill: Analitical, Comunication skills, Continuously learn, Team Work

Work closely with the Development, QA, UX, Design, Content and Project Management teams to strategize, ideate, define and run the planned projects and campaigns and to communicate strategy, progress and results

Requirements: What you’ll need

Demonstrable experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager, both web and apps, is required
Demonstrable experience with Google Optimize and/or other mainstream web & app Optimization and Personalization platforms (eg. Adobe Target, Evergage, Dynamic Yield, Monetate, Leanplum, Tune, Optimizely, Qubit, etc.)
Must have a fluent understanding of Google Marketing Platform, the key benefits and how to leverage the Google stack to the greatest advantage of clients
Hands-on experience working with analytics and experience optimization solutions, ranging from auditing, campaign ideation, definition, setup, launch and reporting, measurement implementations, data analysis & insights, in-housing.
Strong experience in unearthing insights and forming optimization recommendations using heat-mapping
Ability to clearly communicate processes, strategies and general requirements to internal stakeholders
Able to manage projects and delegate seamlessly across multiple teams and regions, to ensure that all deliverables are as per Jellyfish standards and deadlines are met
Able to stay positive under pressure, teamwork with a diverse set of stakeholders and live Jellyfish’s values: be positive, be the solution, be passionate, be accountable, be you

Advantageous: 

Proficiency with Python/R or other scripting languages is highly desirable
Experience with Google Cloud Platform and BigQuery, ability to query large databases and write SQL queries
Experience with (and positive results from) running campaigns on other web and app experience optimization / personalization platforms besides Google Optimize 360 would be highly desirable
Knowledge and experience with recent Google technologies and tools such as Google Analytics for Firebase, App+Web properties and Google Ads Data Hub is a very big plus
Knowledge and experience with Machine Learning principles and Marketing theory is a big plus
Knowledge and experience with advanced segmentation analysis, session playback, lo-fi wireframing, treejacking, designing polls and surveys will be a big plus
Nice to have experience with the following: Adobe Marketing Cloud, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Segment, Tableau and Looker

Job Type: Full-time
Skill_datos: Python, R, SQL, Segmentation, Machine learning, Tableau

Title: Data Science Team Leader
Synopsis: Solid understanding of machine learning.Leadership of an engineering team (technicians / engineers) to meet department’s goals (technical availability, cycle…
Description:
Company Description
Bosch was founded in Stuttgart in 1886 by Robert Bosch (1861-1942) and for more than 130 years has been distinguished by a unique corporate culture based on solid values that drive us to improve every day. Our products, present in a wide variety of fields, that contribute to improve the quality of life of millions of people.

Job Description
Leadership of an engineering team (technicians / engineers) to meet department’s goals (technical availability, cycle time and defect cost targets).
Envisioning, planning, creating, and optimizing data projects for our business partners
Building analytical systems and predictive models
Ensuring proper execution of duties of product and consulting teams
Working with company leadership on the creation of new data science capability for the business by envisioning products and services that will create measurable improvement in our client’s business performance.
Manage a team of data scientists, machine learning engineers, and big data specialists
Lead data mining and collection procedures
Ensure data quality and integrity
Interpret and analyze data problems
Conceive, plan, and prioritize data projects
Build analytic systems and predictive models
Test performance of data-driven products
Visualize data and create reports
Experiment with new models and techniques
Align data projects with organizational goals

Qualifications

Bachelors in Computer science, Systems engineering or related
Advanced English (mandatory)
Proficient in communication to all levels.
Proficient negotiation skills
Strong Leadership skills
Knowledge of database administration.
Basic knowledge in programming (e.g. SQL)
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or similar role
Solid understanding of machine learning
Knowledge of data management and visualization techniques
A knack for statistical analysis and predictive modeling
Good knowledge of R, Python, and MATLAB
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
Strong organizational skills
A business mindset
Master’s degree in Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or any other related quantitative field, preferred.
Availability to travel and no legal restrictions to obtain Mexican Passport & Visa.
Get to know more about how we work at Bosch and our new open positions on our social networks:
Facebook: Bosch Talento México
Instagram: Bosch Campus México
LinkedIn: Bosch México
Additional Information
Bosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 13,000 associates, who develop their full potential in one of the highest quality companies in technology. We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates.

Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Welcome to Bosch.
SoftSkill: Analitical, Comunication skills, Continuously learn, Creativity, Leadership, Organization

Title: AI Solution Architect
Synopsis: Conversational AI (Chat Bots, NLP, NLU, ... with Cognigy).Data / Process Mining (with Celonis).Defines standards and guidelines which (s)he ensures that they…
Description:
Services
Your Role and Responsibilites:
Responsible for the architecture, integration, and design for the following solution platforms/technologies:
Conversational AI (Chat Bots, NLP, NLU, ... with Cognigy)
Machine Learning (Dataiku)
Data / Process Mining (with Celonis)
Machine Reasoning (Arago Hiro)
Defines standards and guidelines which (s)he ensures that they are followed
Reviews and aligns on solution designs
Reviews technical solutions from a data security and access rights (SoD) perspective
Signs off on technical solution design
Is consulted by AI Specialist & Developers on technical assessment and benefit & effort assessment
Collaborates with Business to “Reimagine and Simplify Processes”
Creates and promotes design principles and standards for developing and executing digital AI processes
Performs quality assurance and signs off final deliveries and initiates deployment planning
Leads initiative to build re-useable assets and artifacts
Your Skills and Strenghts
Strong understanding of technologies, programming concepts and background in programming:
API: Rest, Web Services
HTTP/HTTPS methods: Get, Post, Put, Delete
Languages (programming, functional, markup and scripting): Python (3.6 and above), R, JavaScript (ECMAScript 5 & 6), BASH, XML, XAML, HTML
Data standards: JSON, OData, YAML, INI
Programming practices: OOP, inference, JavaScript Promise, State Machin
Containerization: Docker + Kubernetes
Cloud technologies
Legacy IT environment: Linux, Windows 10, Windows Server 2016 (and above)
Databases: PostgreSQL, Graph DB like Neo4j or AWS Neptune, Oracle, Snowflake, MSSQL, Hana DB
Frameworks:
Node.js with Express, Axios, easy-soap-request (or similar)
Flask
Very good knowledge on Artificial Intelligence:
Reasoning System (Expert System)
Machine Learning (categories)
Strong software troubleshooting skills and understanding of programming constructs
Application development, e.g. coding languages like .Net, VB, C+
Excellent understanding of AI methods and concepts
Project Management experience

Good to have:
Knowledge on monitoring (Nagios), event management (TSOM), IT service management (Remedy)
Arago HIRO KI writing
Knowledge of ERP systems (SAP) is a major plus
Process modelling skills are a plus
Green Belt certification is a plus
Do you have any questions?

Are you interested in working with us and developing efficient and environmentally-friendly solutions, optimising existing products, and turning innovative ideas into reality? Title: Demand Planner
Synopsis: As a “Demand Planning Specialist” at HP’s Customer Support Supply Chain (CSSC) Organization for the Personal Systems Platform, you will receive opportunities to…
Description:
We are looking for talented individuals who think out-of-the box, want to experiment with new ideas, create best in class processes and create a foot print for themselves.
As a “Demand Planning Specialist” at HP’s Customer Support Supply Chain (CSSC) Organization for the Personal Systems Platform, you will receive opportunities to apply your creative thinking and analytical skills, further your knowledge of and experience in applying Big Data and Data science techniques using latest tools in and thrive in a growing space.
HP is the world’s leading personal systems and printing company, we create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere. Our innovation springs from a team of individuals, each collaborating and contributing their own perspectives, knowledge, and experience to advance the way the world works and lives.

At HP, the future is yours to create!

We are now Hiring “Demand Planner” for our CS (Customer Support) Supply Chain Organization reporting to Demand Planning Manager under Personal Systems Platform.

If you are our Demand Planner, you will have a chance to

Manage moderately complex demand planning processes through data analytics tools & statistical models throughout service support life
Communicate requirements and guidelines to regional & global business unit planning teams and work with partner management teams to assure supply of spare parts for end user demand
Drive continued & sustained accuracy levels by leveraging historical demand, market and product intelligence, statistical forecasting inputs, AI and Machine Learning
Meet short- & long-term organization goals and financial commitments like Excess and Obsolesce
Work with regional inventory management team to meet level of fill (LOF) goals
Identify and drive process improvements
Support or lead complex projects
Mentor Junior-level staffs
Coordinate, develop and manage a Regulatory Trade Compliance program

Are you a high-performer? We are looking for an individual with:

Strong understanding of forecasting processes and techniques
Strong Analytics & Data science skills, communication and influencing skills; expert in English and local language
Proven relationship management skills
Sound knowledge of Microsoft Office tools, statistical analysis, and financial modeling
Good project management and process re engineering skills, with capability to manage cross functional teams in multiple geographies
Strong business acumen and technical expertise within area of responsibility
Good leadership skills including team building, conflict resolution and management
Good understanding of national and international trade requirements to align customs/trade function with business objectives
About HP


You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.


HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.


Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!
SoftSkill: Analitical, Collaborate, Comunication skills, Continuously learn, Innovation, Leadership, Mentor, Organization, Working with cross functional teams

Title: Data Scientist/ML Engineer
Synopsis: Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms.Experience in Python for data analysis and machine learning.
Description:
*This position is open to work remotely from anywhere in Mexico*

Who is DigitalOnUs by Tech Mahindra?

At DigitalOnUs, we not only provide Agile and DevOps methodologies to our customers, we have adopted the same within the company as well. Our nimble processes are not mired in red tape, yet robust, flexible and result-oriented. We are Software Engineers, Technical Architects, Cloud and DevOps specialists. But the most important, we are dreamers, creators and challengers. Each day, we strive to make great come alive. Our lemma: "work smart and play hard"

Our technology partners are Hashicorp, Cloudbees, Chef, Pagerduty, Docker and SAP.

We are always looking for the brightest candidates to come and we offer a work environment with everything you need to be your best. Does Ambition, Success, Fun, Friends & Learning define your idea of a career? Join us and be part of our family!

We're looking for a Data Scientist/ML Engineer

Areas of responsibility

Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes.
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data.
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns.
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms.

Skills

3 - 4 years of experience as a Data Scientist / ML Engineer
Experience in Python for data analysis and machine learning
Scala
GCP (Google Cloud Platform)


Why will you love this job?

You will be working with a company that is leading its own transformation of the media business by investing in industry-first advertising experiences that drive performance for our advertisers by combining machine learning algorithms with unique rich media executions that are industry-first.

We are looking for innovative thinkers who want to be part of a team that designs & builds new products and deploys the latest technologies for multimedia experiences across mobile apps, OTT devices and the web. Team members who are effective communicators and thrive on cross-team collaborations to help build great products that deliver big business impacts at global scale are highly visible in our team.

What you can expect from us:

At DigitalOnUs, what distinguishes us from other teams is the comfortable environment which engenders trust within teams and with our customers. Trust and openness leads to quality, innovation, commitment to deliverables, efficiency and cost-effectiveness for all our customers.

Empathy for your coworkers and our customers is an important part of success here. As an early stage startup, most people wear many hats.
We're growing at a phenomenal pace and we'd like some company.
Hear your voice, nurture your talent and help you strengthen your footprint!
Benefits above the law
Mentorship, and opportunities to grow and learn

If you are not the owner of this information or have no relation whatsoever with the subjects treated in it, you are requested in the most attentive way not to make copies of it and / or its attached files and delete it immediately, under the risk of being considered as responsible for the unauthorized treatment of personal data in accordance with the Federal Law on Protection of Personal Data Held by Private Parties, its Regulations, and other applicable regulations. If you are the owner of personal data in possession of the Company and wish to obtain further information regarding the processing of your personal data or the exercise of your ARCO rights, please consult our integral privacy notice on the website https://www.digitalonus.com/privacy-policy/
